title: Hungry Mother Blues
label: Trekky Records
description: Megafaun member offers his solo debut, a collection of instrumental folk compositions mostly for acoustic guitar, banjo, and harmonica.

title: What Did You Expect From the Vaccines?
label: Columbia
description: Another retrograde UK guitar band held up as the Next Big Thing, the very solid Vaccines aren't either as good or bad as that claim suggests.

title: Circuital
label: ATO
description: Toning down some of the experimentation of Evil Urges, My Morning Jacket return with an album that touches on highlights from their earlier work.

title: Simple Math
label: Columbia
description: Conor Oberst acolyte continues to question everything from marriage to love to religion to sex but wraps much of it in a ponderous alt-rock framework.

title: Last
label: Rough Trade
description: Two sisters from the north of England put their own spin on tradtional British folk.

title: Arghiledes / Leaving the Commonwealth
label: Thrill Jockey
description: No-Neck Blues Band member offers two new solo records, one focusing on the honkytonks of the American South and the other on the tekedes of Greece.

title: Super Mom
label: self-released
description: Following the breakup of Radioclit, one half of the production duo, Johan Hugo, teams again with exuberant singer Esau Mwamwaya for a new mixtape.

title: Ideas For Songs
label: Triple Crown
description: Initially issued on a limited cassette, this odd and varied collection of early home recordings by Dan Bejar has been given a vinyl/digital reissue.

title: Brave Irene EP
label: Slumberland
description: Indie pop veteran Rose Melberg returns with a new band and a new sound that touches on the thick sonics of the Flying Nun stable.

title: Future Accidents
label: Our Mouth
description: New York noise trio offers its mellowest album yet, filled with Krautrock-inspired grooves and a 19-minute abstract audio sculpture.

title: People Changes
label: Western Vinyl
description: The busy bassist from Dirty Projectors returns with another strong solo album that focuses mostly on double-bass and voice.

title: MMG Presents: Self Made, Vol. 1
label: Maybach
description: On a major roll these last couple of years, Rick Ross here assembles an introduction to his label, which includes Wale and Meek Mill.

title: Teenage Hate
label: Goner
description: This CD/vinyl reissue of the astonishingly intense LP from Jay Reatard's early band adds the cassette-only Fuck Elvis Here's the Reatards as a bonus.

title: Blue Suicide
label: Wonder Beard Tapes
description: Mat Cothran's one-man downer project creates an ambitious and arresting American Gothic album despite financial limitations.

title: Fever
label: When In Doubt
description: Dutch post-dubstep producer finds inspiration in his parents' old disco vinyl as source material for his new recording.

title: Black Earth
label: Kranky
description: Chicago quartet crafts a murky and claustrophobic record with debts to Mogwai and early Sonic Youth but a narrative thrust all its own.

title: Pala
label: XL
description: UK band continues to make high-stakes music that excels best when acknowledging its dance-rock present rather than its emotive past.

title: Let Love In / Murder Ballads / The Boatman's Call / No More Shall We Part
label: Mute
description: The latest batch of Mute's deluxe reissues shows that the 1990s were very good to Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds.

title: Wallahi Le Zein!! Wezin, Jakwar And Guitar Boogie From The Islamic Republic Of Mauritania
label: Latitudes
description: This is a rare comp of Mauritania's Beydane and Haratine music, one of the few global sounds without any music industry surrounding it.

title: Noir
label: Fake Four
description: Like Clams Casino's recent work, this veteran hip-hop production duo crafts versatile, moody instrumentals with a patient, steady beauty.

title: It's a Corporate World
label: Warner Bros.
description: Despite all the NASCAR-related playfulness, Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr. are a sweet, fairly unassuming electro-tinged indie pop band.

title: Alegrías
artist: Howe Gelb & a Band of Gypsies
label: Fire
description: Giant Sand leader takes a soft left into flamenco-tinged gypsy folk that was recorded in Spain with a group of Andalucian gypsies.

title: Demolished Thoughts
label: Matador
description: The Sonic Youth frontman gets production assistance from Beck on a rich and satisfying acoustic-oriented LP.

title: In Blank
label: Ernest Jenning
description: Former Q and Not U drummer John Davis offers his second album as Title Tracks, a raucous blast of fast-paced, quick-tempered power-pop.

title: Confetti
label: Mush
description: Latest from a Chicago outfit that specializes in rangy, wildly percussive indie pop and takes cues from Sigur Rós.

title: Le Secret EP
label: Prophecy
description: Eclectic French metal artist Neige recently re-recorded his second EP and presents the results in five distinct editions.

title: Casablanca Nights
label: Paper Bag
description: Swedish Italo disco producer's latest album features frequent collaborator Sally Shapiro, as well as CFCF.

title: Brilliant! Tragic!
label: Cooking Vinyl
description: The playful, whipsmart UK band returns, this time with leader Eddie Argos trying his hand at some actual singing.

title: Grateful to Shred
label: Marriage
description: A product of Portland, Ore.'s DIY punk scene, White Fang find a good balance between gleeful destruction and laughs.

title: Strange Hearts
label: Western Vinyl
description: With a love of both atmosphere and 1960s harmonies, this North Dakota band finds itself in a lane with the Morning Benders and Grizzly Bear.

title: We Are the Champions
label: Infinity Cat Recordings
description: Former Be Your Own Pet members add shades of Weezer-like power-pop to their economy-sized psych-rock.

title: Nursing Home
label: Merge
description: Brit-punk trio comprehensively captures the mindset of young men kicking and screaming against their inevitable transition into adulthood.

title: Attention Please / Heavy Rocks
label: Sargent House
description: Japanese heavy rock heroes release two LPs at once, but they aren't what you'd expect: one is electropop and shoegaze, the other a metal grab bag.

title: Darkbloom EP
label: Hippos in Tanks
description: This split EP pairs tracks from two Montreal artists: the ghostly avant-pop project Grimes and the more literate singer-songwriter d'Eon.

title: Excerpts
label: Fat Cat
description: Björk collaborator Olivier Alary marries elements of film score and classical music to more experimental avenues.

title: Passed Me By
label: Modern Love
description: The Manchester-based producer who shares a label and an M.O. with Demdike Stare turns dance music exuberance into feelings of loneliness and dread.

title: Her Favorite Colo(u)r
label: Nature Sounds
description: Once a free mixtape, the indie hip-hop mainstay's latest-- with a nice dusty, lived-in feel-- is now an official release.

title: Director's Cut
label: EMI
description: The art-rocker reworks songs from The Sensual World and The Red Shoes, offering a rethink of a somewhat controversial period in her career.

title: Go With Me
label: Hardly Art
description: Seattle trio crafts a record filled with childlike melancholy and wonderment that nonetheless comes off as garden-variety twee.

title: Collected By Itself: 2006 to 2009
label: Captured Tracks
description: Once the work of an indie outlier, this collection of Mike Sniper's distorted, minimalist synth-rock is more like the (retro-minded) Sound of Right Now.

title: Street of the Love of Days
label: Merge
description: The Clientele's Alasdair MacLean and Pipas' Lupe Núñez-Fernández combine for an LP of pastoral, sometimes psychedelic chamber pop.

title: Rock & Roll Submarine
label: UO
description: Sixteen years after their last full-length release, Chicago's Urge Overkill return with a new album and a fuzzy sense of purpose.

title: Turtleneck & Chain
label: Universal Republic
description: What started as "Saturday Night Live" spoofs has now made Andy Samberg & co. into pop stars. Justin Timberlake, Rihanna, and Nicki Minaj guest.

title: Innings
label: Woodsist
description: San Francisco trio moves to Woodsist but maintains the same style of sprightly, brief songs explored on its debut.

title: Laced
label: Fat Cat
description: Now a duo, the self-proclaimed shitgaze band isn't just tearing things down, it's building something unique out of the rubble.

title: The Double Cross
label: Yep Roc
description: Twenty years in, these Canadians still know how to do power pop right, and this brief and varied LP is one of their best.

title: Roadkill Rising... The Bootleg Collection 1977-2009
label: Shout! Factory
description: Four-disc collection covering four decades of Iggy Pop's raucous live shows paints an elaborate portrait of an original punk.

title: Own Your Ghost
label: Anticon
description: Latest from members of American post-rap duo Themselves and the German electro-pop band Notwist zips back and forth between their contrasting sounds.

title: Diaper Island
label: Sub Pop
description: The Canadian singer/songwriter/producer turns in a more focused album with a sonic palette reminiscent of his recent production work for Women.

title: Feel It Break
label: Domino
description: Latest in a line of goth-pop artists-- think Bat for Lashes or Zola Jesus-- to emerge in recent years issues a promising Domino debut.

title: Destroyed
label: Mute
description: Moby's latest is a soundtrack for late-night cityscapes that plays like a facile representation of these environs instead of an exploration of them.

title: 93 Million Miles
label: Warp
description: Longtime electronic fixtures Mark Pritchard and Steve Spacek craft an adventurous, wildly eclectic Warp debut.

title: Rome
label: Capitol
description: The famed producer teams with the Italian composer to attempt to salvage the "soundtrack without a movie" concept album. Jack White and Norah Jones guest.

title: Creep On Creepin' On
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Canadian group mixes retro-rock with elements of doo-wop- and blues-indebted minimalism. Colin Stetson guests.

title: Telesterion
label: Rodriguez López
description: Even as a wide-ranging, 2xCD/4xLP summary of the Mars Volta member's last decade of activity, this compilation offers only a hint of the scope of his project.

title: Don’t Rock the Boat, Sink the Fucker
label: Lovitt
description: Aimée Collet Argote's ever-shifting project releases an engaging, incisive album of compelling contradictions and frictions.

title: Aesthethica
label: Thrill Jockey
description: The world's best hipster black metal band unsurprisingly crafts a great crossover-friendly black metal album.

title: Smother
label: Domino
description: The uncompromising UK art-pop group returns with a record that continues down the path of Two Dancers, paring its sound down even further.

title: Sons of Stone
label: HoZac
description: Hailing from Lansing, Mich., the People's Temple make Nuggets-style garage rock with energy and attention to detail.

title: A Young Person's Guide to Mark McGuire
label: Editions Mego
description: Emeralds leader gathers highlights from his small-run releases, offering explorations in minimalism, kosmische, and rock.

title: The January EP
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Luke Temple's exploratory psych-pop group settles into one headspace-- the narcotized, childlike folk-pop of Syd Barrett or the Move-- on this new EP.

title: The Moonlight Butterfly
label: Thrill Jockey
description: For some time the Sea and Cake have delivered low-key, expertly played aural comfort food, but they add new wrinkles here for the first time in years.

title: Burst Apart
label: Frenchkiss
description: After the crushing intensity of Hospice, the Antlers return with a more refined and sophisticated LP that still forges a powerful emotional connection.

title: Women's Studies
label: Planet Mu
description: A pan-global dance synthesist in the vein of Diplo, Chrissy Murderbot employs Chicago footwork and 90s rave to build uptempo, record-collection dance.

title: Back and 4th
label: Hotflush
description: One of the leading labels in the post-dubstep UK bass world-- Hotflush, home to Mount Kimbie, Joy Orbison, and Untold-- issues its first label compilation.

title: I'll Never Get Out of This World Alive
label: New West
description: The beloved singer-songwriter continues to give voice to the disenfranchised and show empathy for anyone and everyone.

title: Diotima
label: Profound Lore
description: Black metal band creates marathons out of marathons that demand complete attention and destroy attention spans.

title: Goblin
label: XL
description: Following months of anticipation and hype, Odd Future's anarchic leader drops his second full-length: the bleak and uncompromising Goblin.

title: Celebration, Florida
label: Fat Possum
description: The latest detail-heavy record from this folk-rock group examines the dark side of American spectacle.

title: Sketches From the Book of the Dead
label: Mute
description: After a lengthy career at Nick Cave's right hand, plus work with PJ Harvey and others, the former Bad Seed issues his first solo album of originals.

title: Air Museum
label: Thrill Jockey
description: On its latest full-length, the Brooklyn drone duo favors analog electronics and pedals as it creates live in the studio.

title: Rainforest EP
label: Tri Angle
description: Beatmaker for Lil B and Soulja Boy takes steps away from for-hire work to showcase his excellent original material.

title: Past Life Martyred Saints
label: Souterrain Transmissions
description: Erika M. Anderson emerges from the ashes of her former project Gowns with an unsettlingly beautiful collection of songs about pain and loss.

title: Dead to Me
label: Slumberland
description: The sprightly, well-played surf-rock from this Belfast outfit on Slumberland hides a darker undercurrent that reveals itself with further listens.

title: Left By Soft
artist: David Kilgour and the Heavy Eights
label: Merge
description: Guitarist from the Clean releases his second album with the Heavy Eights, and like most of his solo work, it has a relaxed and quietly accomplished air.

title: Diorama
label: Traum
description: Former part-time forest ranger and creator of a string of excellent techno 12"s returns with a comparatively composed and well-felt long player.

title: False Beats and True Hearts
description: The duo probably best known for being the rhythm section in Galaxie 500 issues another lush, expansive collaboration with Ghost guitarist Michio Kurihara.

title: I Am Very Far
label: Jagjaguwar
description: After a run of concept albums, Will Sheff's literate indie rock project returns with a collection of unrelated songs united by the dense production.

title: Beer in the Breakers
label: Moshi Moshi
description: Lyrics-heavy British group's first LP to be released in its original form in the U.S. gets a few bits lost in translation.

title: La Caverne
label: Dare to Care
description: Francophone Montreal band continues to fuse psychedelia, prog- and classic rock, disco, and new wave into exuberant, easily grasped songs.

title: Gunz n' Butta
label: E1
description: Cam'ron again teams with Harlem rapper Vado-- here combining with rising producer AraabMuzik-- for a one-dimensional yet highly listenable record.

title: Ascension
label: Caldo Verde
description: Justin Broadrick continues to make beautiful, sad music with his Jesu project, here really leaning on the sound of isolation.

title: Eye Contact
label: 4AD
description: This difficult-to-classify New York band has crafted its finest, weirdest, and most uplifting statement yet.

title: Flora
label: Kora
description: This Swedish post-rock band is sometimes reminiscent of Radiohead or the Notwist, but their new album takes additional cues from dance music.

title: The Deep Field
label: PIAS
description: Joan Wasser's third album as Police Woman lacks the marquee guest stars of her former work, and finds her struggling to find a compelling voice.

title: Covert Coup
label: Warner Bros.
description: Two versatile hip-hop vets-- each in a nice patch in their tumultuous careers-- combine for a tape of dense lyrics and evocative tracks. Freddie Gibbs guests.

title: Life Fantastic
label: Anti-
description: Man Man's fourth LP is their most tasteful and well-produced record to date, but with the darkest, most frightening lyrics the band has written.

title: The Perfect Lullaby
label: self-released
description: L.A. production duo continues to do no wrong, including this wide-eyed, creative reshuffling of the piles of au courant music.

title: Talahomi Way
label: Drag City
description: Expert arranger and unabashed Beach Boys fan Sean O'Hagan again twists the High Llamas' aesthetic on this tasteful and somewhat filmic LP.

title: Deep Politics
label: Temporary Residence
description: Portland instrumental act continues to swallow entire genres whole with its sludgy, shapeshifting post-rock.

title: Trainsong: Guitar Compositions 1967–2010 / Fully Qualified Survivor
label: Tompkins Square
description: These two releases-- a reissue of a highly regarded album from 1970 and a career retrospective-- show the range of the British folk guitarist's art.

title: Cat's Eyes
label: Polydor
description: Horrors frontman Faris Badwan teams with an opera singer for a charming record of soft-focus pop.

title: Hot Sauce Committee Part Two
label: Capitol
description: Ad-Rock, MCA, and Mike D return to the thicker, heavier sound they ushered in with Check Your Head and Ill Communication.

title: Earth Grid
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Lungfish guitarist Asa Osborne relies on patience and repetition to craft music that seems to ride off into a hypnotic sunset.

title: The Everything
label: Staatsakt
description: One of the stars and chief innovators in last decade's sample-based arts returns with an LP driven by wide-ranging eclecticism.

title: Broadcast
label: Black Acre
description: Bristol producer follows his bass-heavy "Phoenix" single with a more sprawled-out album that takes its cues from film scores and 80s synth music.

title: Absence
label: Dot Dash
description: This unique and bracing avant-rock band, originally from Perth in Western Australia, calls it quits and steps out on a high note.

title: thecontrollersphere EP
label: Polyvinyl
description: This deck-clearing EP of False Priest leftovers hints that Of Montreal may be completing the arc started on 2007's Hissing Fauna...

title: Knee Deep
label: Kompakt
description: Making the leap to Kompakt, this Danish trio continues its gradual slide toward chillier, moodier dance rock.

title: Forever Today
label: Mute
description: The huge Swedish group-- now 27 members-- offers Broadway-sized tweeness as a way to convey indie pop's intimacy on a massive sing-along scale.

title: James Pants
label: Stones Throw
description: Taking sounds that were unusual or anachronistic to begin with, this Stones Throw artist synthesizes the past in a seamless and intensely retro way.

title: Adventures in Counter-Culture
label: Rhymesayers
description: After the Golden Age love and pedantic moralizing of his previous LP, Blueprint crafts a more ambitious, diverse, and less agenda-driven follow-up.

title: Helplessness Blues
label: Sub Pop
description: After making a splash in 2008 with a strong EP and brilliant full-length debut, Fleet Foxes return with a darker album that's equally assured.

title: Losing Colour
label: Kora
description: The now-defunct UK band moves from post-punk revivalism to new wave on its final album-- a path forged by many original post-punk artists 30 years ago.

title: Golden Era
label: the council
description: Years after he looked like a crossover star, Del's still putting out old-school underground hip-hop albums built on furious rhymes and understated beats.

title: The Only She Chapters
label: Warp
description: Prefuse 73's latest diverges from the glitch-hop pattern of One Word Extinguisher to incorporate vocals from Zola Jesus and the late Trish Keenan.

title: Best of 00-10
label: Nettwerk
description: Few would have expected Ladytron to last a full decade, but here they are in 2011 with a well-chosen comp that includes two new tracks.

title: Dancer Equired
label: Merge
description: Moving from Matador to Merge, the scuzz-pop stars offer their first LP without the noise that sheathed their work from the start.

title: Circus
label: Lo
description: The French producer once shrouded in mystery returns with an album of collaborations with artsts like Jon Spencer, YACHT, and Afrika Bambaataa.

title: Canyon Candy EP
label: Luaka Bop
description: Despite coming wrapped in all sorts of Record Store Day affectations, this concept EP about the American frontier is quirky without being overtly goofy.

title: Cornershop and the Double-O Groove Of
label: Ample Play
description: 1990s cult act's second laser-focused record in three years finds the band blending Britpop, trip-hop, psych, and folk-- here into Punjabi giddha music.

title: Claire Denis Film Scores 1996-2009
label: Constellation
description: Spread over 15 years, this gorgeous set celebrates the partnership between the underrated neo-classicist UK band and the celebrated modern French filmmaker.

title: The Book of David
label: Mad Science
description: Two decades in, the gifted West Coast producer/rapper is making some of the most inventive music of his career.

title: Not Nothing
label: Kanine
description: The latest in a rich outpouring of American garage-rock, this Kanine band is long on charm and JAMC references.

title: Born With Stripes
label: Dead Oceans
description: Whether sounding like Pavement, early 70s country-rock, or the Byrds, this Dead Oceans band captures a uniquely California sound.

title: The Drawing Board
label: Crosstown Rebels
description: Following the promising "Without You" single, this Toronto house duo's debut LP often leans on that track's feeling of depression and hollowness.

title: Thao & Mirah
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: Mirah's handmade, soft songs and Thao Nguyen's more serrated work might not seem a good collaborative match, but the PacNW stalwarts make it work.

title: Swanlights EP
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Antony's latest features another Oneohtrix Point Never collab, the Swanlights LP's title track, and new songs that may hint at future directions.

title: Figurines
label: Control Group
description: After attempting too much on their last album, this Danish indie rock band returns to the negative space and get-up-and-go of 2006's Skeleton.

title: Music's Not For Everyone
label: K
description: Ian Svenonius again takes on the self-aware dual role of singing pop songs while subtly critiquing their conventions.

title: Music Sounds Better With You
label: Labrador
description: The Swedish band on Labrador returns after a long layoff with what might be its most confident and assured record yet.

title: Start and Complete
label: Domino
description: Members of Hot Chip, This Heat, and Spiritualized continue their off-the-cuff, loose, quickly recorded, rewarding sessions.

title: Terra
label: Underwater Peoples
description: Julian Lynch follows 2010's Mare with another low-key and accomplished album that mixes elements of jazz, folk, ambient, drone, and more.

title: Beyond the 4th Door
label: Thrill Jockey
description: After a series of small releases on labels such as Not Not Fun, Digitalis, and Three Lobed, this immersive psych band makes its Thrill Jockey debut.

title: Gatto Fritto
label: International Feel
description: UK producer makes exploratory, jammy electronic music, finding inspiration in Detroit techno, Tangerine Dream, and Kraftwerk.

title: Vigilante Season
label: Amalgam Digital
description: On his proper full-length debut, the mixtape veteran and Jim Jones ghostwriter tempers street-rap hardness with glimmers of emotional nuance.

title: Operation: Doomsday
label: Metalface
description: This instant cult classic returns in a lavish deluxe edition complete with bonus material, commemorative playing cards, and yes, a lunchbox.

title: Take Care, Take Care, Take Care
label: Temporary Residence
description: The last band standing playing primarily dramatic loud/soft instrumental post-rock returns with an LP of loud/soft instrumental post-rock.

title: Mass Dream
label: In the Red
description: Mirroring the spooky air of Women, TV Ghost are another stark, tense band trading in the post- and proto-punk abandon of Pere Ubu or the Cramps.

title: GB City
label: Fat Possum
description: Debut from another band in an increasingly crowded field of neo-classicist rock bands specializing in fuzzy assault.

title: Secret Walls EP
label: Sacred Bones
description: San Francisco band offers its latest EP, further mining the sock-hopping sounds of its Grey-Eyed Girls but with a few unexpected change-ups.

title: Revenue Retrievin': Overtime Shift / Graveyard Shift
label: EMI
description: The Bay area street rap veteran is currently enjoying a renaissance, and these latest entries in the Revenue Retrievin' series keep his streak alive.

title: WIT'S END
label: Domino
description: The enigmatic singer-songwriter returns with a dark set of songs backed by spare instrumentation and crafts what might be his best LP yet.

title: Canary
label: Misra
description: Ohio band crafts a concept album centered around one Appalachian family trying to shoulder its way through the Great Depression.

title: In and Out of Youth and Lightness
label: Temporary Residence
description: Nineties indie rock throwbacks start to stretch out their grimy rock into longer songs that go more for atmosphere than fury.

title: Jonny
label: Merge
description: Norman Blake (Teenage Fanclub) and Euros Childs (Gorky's Zygotic Mynci) team and lean more toward Blake's power-pop than Childs' psych and country.

title: Benefit for the Recovery in Japan
label: Antiopic
description: Clocking in at nearly five hours, this rich, sprawling 64-track set sees no contradiction between charity and musical adventurousness.

title: EPs 1991-2002
label: Warp
description: Dizzying as it may be as a whole, this 47-track box is one of the better introductions to the flagship post-rave/home-listening electronic act's work.

title: Sleep Talk
label: 1-2-3-4 Go!
description: Oakland band featuring one of Hunx's Punkettes offers its sophomore album of sonically diverse garage rock.

title: The Golden Record
label: Secretly Canadian
description: Montreal-based singer-songwriter Laurel Sprengelmeyer, recording with members of Arcade Fire and the National, steps out with an assured debut.

title: Walk the River
label: Geffen
description: Third album from the Mercury Prize-nominated group proves it still has a few eccentricities up its sleeve.

title: XI versions of Black Noise
label: Rough Trade
description: After years of rarely hearing Pantha's singular style deconstructed, he issues this remix album, with help from Animal Collective and Four Tet.

title: Return of 4Eva
label: self-released
description: On his new mixtape, the Mississippi rapper shows his mastery of classic Southern rap and crafts an ideal soundtrack for long drives with the windows open.

title: The English Riviera
label: Atlantic
description: Former blog-house band has fully transitioned into a sleek, urbane pop-rock outfit, taking polished cues from Steely Dan and Phoenix.

title: Family Portrait
label: Underwater Peoples
description: On their debut, Family Portrait look ready to come into their own, distilling the essence of Underwater People's familiar fuss-free garage jangle.

title: Outmind
label: Brainfeeder
description: Released on Flying Lotus' Brainfeeder imprint, this is another texture-heavy, blunted take on West Coast instrumental hip-hop.

title: Outside
label: Ernest Jenning
description: New York City-based quintet releases its third album of scrappy, Americana-seeped folk songs.

title: TRON: Legacy Reconfigured
label: Walt Disney
description: Daft Punk's TRON: Legacy work gets remixed by an odd crossection of producers, including Moby, Paul Oakenfold, Photek, and the Crystal Method.

title: Bespoke
label: Ninja Tune
description: An enjoyable mess, at its best this LP comes off like someone messing with a radio dial. Busdriver, Baths, Bilal, and Inara George guest.

title: The Head and the Heart
label: Sub Pop
description: Sub Pop re-releases this Seattle group's debut, which is heavy on old-time instrumentation, wan gospel harmonies, and heart-on-sleeve songwriting.

title: Black Sun
label: Hyperdub
description: Hyperdub's flagship producer once again teams up with the earthen-voiced dread poet to find new ways of injecting a sense of anxiety into dubstep.

title: A I A : Alien Observer / A I A : Dream Loss
label: Yellowelectric
description: Despite working in an increasingly rich and crowded ambient-pop field, Grouper's Liz Harris continues to own her distinctive sound on these LPs.

title: w h o k i l l
label: 4AD
description: Upping the ante from her 2009 debut, Merrill Garbus fuses acoustic folk, R&B, funk, Afro-pop, and rock into a bold, uncompromising hybrid all her own.

title: No Problem
label: Downtown
description: Parisian electro-pop duo enlist Justice's Xavier de Rosnay and Daft Punk's sound engineer Peter Franco for production duties on their debut LP.

title: Hit After Hit
label: Fat Possum
description: Sonny Smith continues to excel at simple, low-stakes music done extremely well, with clever touches that don't reveal themselves on first listen.

title: Lollipop
label: Megaforce
description: Three albums into their career reboot, the classic 80s indie rockers continue to mine a more laid-back direction.

title: So Beautiful or So What
label: Hear Music
description: Still fascinated by old R&B, gospel, and world music, the legendary songwriter here blends them into a laidback, spry pop sound.

title: Wasting Light
label: Roswell
description: The back-to-basics album Wasting Light reunites Dave Grohl with producer Butch Vig and former Nirvana mates Krist Novoselic and Pat Smear.

title: Outdoor Spell
label: Northern Spy
description: The avant-garde guitar legend-- best known for crafting pieces for overpowering groups of musicians-- makes his Northern-Spy Records debut.

title: Dream Diary
label: K
description: K Records troubadour continues his curious obsession with sleep and dreams, here marrying sleek'n'minimal synths to alt-rock guitars in the process.

title: Salon des Amateurs
label: Fat Cat
description: Best known for recordings for chamber ensemble or prepared piano, Haushcka here embraces house music. Members of múm and Calexico guest.

title: In Love With Oblivion
label: Slumberland
description: One of the best of Brooklyn's lo-fi jangle bands follows its debut with a sophomore effort colored by tighter intra-band cohesion and playfulness.

title: Mirrorwriting
label: Polydor
description: Located at the midpoint between UK bass and swooning lounge pop, Jamie Woon follows Katy B and James Blake as justifiably big-deal potential crossovers.

title: Reptilians
label: Polyvinyl
description: Latest from yet another band finding success in the vaguely psych, synth-loving wake of MGMT's Oracular Spectacular.

title: Smart Flesh
label: Nonesuch
description: Working within time-honored folk tropes, this East Coast band aims for the sort of tasteful, easily identifiable sound that always finds an audience.

title: Do Whatever You Want All the Time
label: We Are Free
description: Ponytail's third album finds them mixing the spastic exuberance of Ice Cream Spiritual with the more heady approach of recent side projects.

title: The Family Sign
label: Rhymesayers
description: Slug returns, stripping some of the more larger-than-life traits of misspent youth away from his approach and tilting more towards plainspoken sincerity.

title: Apocalypse
label: Drag City
description: After the delicate, warm Sometimes I Wish We Were an Eagle, Bill Callahan returns with a more idiosyncratic record.

title: Sucre du Sauvage
label: Goner
description: Recorded during a three-month residency as a museum installation, the latest from Quintron and Miss Pussycat is literally performance art.

title: Here Before
label: Bar/None
description: The Feelies' first LP in 20 years finds them with nothing to prove as they mine the pastoral power-pop of their post-Crazy Rhythms career.

title: In Concert: Brandeis University 1963
label: Columbia
description: Originally released as a bonus to accompany the crucial Witmark Demos, this live set gets its own release as a standalone album.

title: C'mon
label: Sub Pop
description: The slowcore band's ninth album comes off like a tour of the various twists and turns in direction it's taken over the years.

title: Nine Types of Light
label: Interscope
description: After their first break in years-- and moving their home base from Brooklyn to L.A.-- TVOTR return with their most patient, positive recording to date.

title: Giving & Receiving
label: K
description: Crafting delicate, ornate songs, this indie pop band aims to balance surprise (elements of soul) and the expected (cute precociousness).

title: Here We Rest
label: Lightning Rod
description: Former Drive-By Truckers member releases another spotty set of songs aiming to capture the spirit and pace of life in the New New South.

title: EUPHORIC /// HEARTBREAK \\\
label: Columbia
description: The heavy-handed skyscraping continues on the Scottish rock band's second album, this time with vague, non-specific lyrics to match.

title: Share the Joy
label: Polyvinyl
description: Vivian Girls' third LP, recorded at the home studio of Woods' Jarvis Taveniere, finds them experimenting with self-referential songwriting and guitar solos.

title: Tomboy
label: Paw Tracks
description: Four years on from the landmark Person Pitch, Panda Bear returns with a record that embraces both summer fun and hushed spirituality.

title: A Thousand Heys
label: Fat Cat
description: London-via-Manchester quartet makes a commendable entry into the UK DIY indie realm with their FatCat debut.

title: Doggumentary
label: Priority
description: Now mostly famous for being famous, Snoop releases his latest reminder to the world that he's still an active musician.

title: Instrumental Mixtape
label: self-released
description: The up-and-coming beatmaker's work for Lil B helped define the woozy "based" aesthetic, but heard on their own, his productions are even more powerful.

title: Raven in the Grave
label: Vice
description: The Danish indie rock chameleons take a darker turn on their latest, moving in the direction of 1980s goth.

title: Rolling Papers
label: Atlantic
description: Now back on a major label after an independent stint, this long-developing hip-hop star releases a surprisingly cohesive full-length.

title: Human Hearts
label: Dangerbird
description: Former Dismemberment Plan and Promise Ring members continue to evolve and take a more holistic approach to indie rock than their former bands.

title: Idle Labor
label: Captured Tracks
description: Debut album from this Stockton, Calif., bedroom producer mines the same synth-heavy 1980s indie sounds as Wild Nothing or Twin Shadow.

title: Hanna OST
label: Back Lot
description: The 90s dance titans follow their best album in years with the soundtrack to an action film.

title: Illusions of Grandeur
label: self-released
description: The Based God offers his most cohesive and coherent collection of songs in a long time, including some seemingly designed to please the Okayplayer crowd.

title: Street Halo
label: Hyperdub
description: Burial returns with his first new solo work since 2007; it walks the emotional terrain as his past work yet subtly pushes his sound in new directions.

title: Paranoid Cat
label: Family Vineyard
description: Founding member of avant-rock band Peeesseye recalls everything from Crazy Horse to Glenn Branca to jam bands on this exploratory LP.

title: Some Cold Rock Stuf
label: Stones Throw
description: Stones Throw contributor and Madlib's go-to DJ crafts an album that's more a collection of scattered concept pieces than a unified statement.

title: Alela Diane & Wild Divine
label: Rough Trade
description: On her third album and now backed by a road-tested band, Alela Diane trades fraught freak folk for dusty country-rock.

title: Fear of God
label: Re-Up
description: A confusing affair, the latest mixtape from the Clipse star features Rick Ross, Kanye West, 50 Cent, and very little effort from anyone.

title: Blood Pressures
label: Domino
description: The Kills' latest retreats from Midnight Boom's dancefloor directives in an attempt to broaden their palette, with mixed results.

title: Last of the Country Gentlemen
label: Mute
description: Former Lift to Experience frontman releases an LP, captured mostly live, of his folk guitar playing blended with quasi-Biblical lyrics.

title: Only the Lonely EP
label: Surrender All
description: James Lavelle's long-running project continues to explore psych-rock textures, here with help from Nick Cave and the Duke Spirit's Liela Moss.

title: Flux Outside
label: Glassnote
description: The third album from this hyperkinetic band from Knoxville finds them mixing the spastic rush of math rock with a bit of Southern boogie.

title: Michel Poiccard
label: Counter
description: Following the death of member Beau Velasco, the notoriously wacky band dials down its wilder instincts a bit on this sophomore offering.

title: The Flaming Lips With Neon Indian
label: Warner Bros.
description: This brief, quickly assembled EP follows in the darkly psychedelic vein of the Flaming Lips last album, 2009's Embryonic.

title: Screws Get Loose
label: Oh Wow Dang
description: Sophomore effort from this Tennessee quartet expands upon the classic-country sounds of their debut, at times venturing into retro-pop territory.

title: Hyphenated-Man
label: Org
description: Finding inspiration in Hieronymus Bosch and his old punk band the Minutemen, Mike Watt delivers his best record in years.

title: Moment Bends
label: V2
description: Australian indie-pop band continues to move away from the precocious and cute toward a more streamlined, highly polished sound.

title: Badlands
label: Zoo
description: Alex Zhang Hungtai takes a sense of displacement and an ear for eerie, stylized noirish sounds and creates something unique and refreshing.

title: Cherish the Light Years
label: Matador
description: Cold Cave continue to tap into the emotional space of 1980s new wave as they fully transform themselves into a big, bold, goth-pop group.

title: Mrs. Jones' Cookies
label: Empty Cellar
description: This San Francisco band with a loose and playful spin on rockabilly and country & western sounds better than ever on its second full-length.

title: Holy Ghost!
label: DFA
description: After several years of singles and an EP, the NYC-based electro-pop outfit makes its full-length debut.

title: Chopped & Screwed
label: Rough Trade
description: This collaboration between the junkshop-pop group and a London orchestral ensemble is conceptually fascinating but sporadically engaging.

title: Mind Bokeh
label: Warp
description: Stephen Wilkinson's Bibio project continues to surprise, pushing further out of his comfort zone and venturing boldly into new territory.

title: Belong
artist: The Pains of Being Pure at Heart
label: Slumberland
description: Rather than repeat the 80s indie pop they'd so expertly nailed, Pains trade up to 90s-style alt-rock-- a potentially risky gamble-- and nail that too.

title: Faded Days
label: self-released
description: Savannah, Georgia, bedroom producer's debut lyrically touches on nostalgia while at times recalling fellow Georgian Bradford Cox's loop-based soundscapes.

title: Antonionian
label: Anticon
description: Jordan Dalrymple, formerly of the unclassifiable avant-rap outfit Subtle, offers up a full-length debut that mixes pop, rock, funk, R&B, and hip-hop.

title: Quiet Storm
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Rafter Roberts is a musical chameleon, and this recent digital-only release finds him venturing into harsher textures.

title: Live on I-5
label: Interscope
description: For the second time in the past year, these 90s titans get an unusual, unneeded, and poorly crafted reissue campaign instead of one they deserve.

title: Meyrin Fields EP
label: Columbia
description: Danger Mouse and the Shins' James Mercer release a four-song EP of outtakes and B-sides from their initial sessions, an epilogue of sorts to their LP.

title: Actor-Caster
label: Park the Van
description: Catchy and instantly memorable at best, a little cloying at worst, Generationals continue to create harmlessly prototypical indie pop.

title: Rio Arriba
label: ZZK
description: This hypnotic and immersive album from a young Argentinian producer has been billed as "digital cumbia" and it offers an intriguing mix of past and present.

title: Moody, Standard and Poor
label: Sub Pop
description: Former Hot Snakes and Edsel members reconvene for their second Sub Pop LP as Obits, and once again jettison atonal bashing in favor of space and subtlety.

title: The Return of Mr. Zone 6
label: Warner Bros.
description: On his new street album, Gucci attempts to reverse his recent losing streak and update his style in a changing rap landscape.

title: Vs. [Legacy Edition] / Vitalogy [Legacy Edition] / Live at the Orpheum Theatre, Boston
label: Legacy
description: Twenty years after their debut, Pearl Jam reissue the LPs that marked their peak cultural impact and transformation into the world's biggest cult act.

title: Alexander
label: Community Music
description: Alexander Ebert, frontman of Edward Sharpe & the Magnetic Zeros, steps out with a solo album as eclectic and occasionally frustrating as his main band.

title: Nightingale
label: Yep Roc
description: Erland Cooper crafts folk-inflected tales with help from the Verve's Simon Tong and inspiration from a poltergeist.

title: Too Young to Be in Love
label: Hardly Art
description: After a smattering of singles and a compilation, this raucous garage-pop outfit with an eye for the perils of teen love offers its full-length debut.

title: On a Mission
label: Columbia
description: Rising, genre-spanning pop star Katy B's debut builds on the promise of her early singles, adding vocal finesse and feminine appeal to UK bass music.

title: House of Balloons
label: self-released
description: This project has ridden a wave of online buzz thanks in part to a deliberately murky backstory, but the music, a kind of spectral R&B, transcends hype.

title: As High as the Highest Heavens and From the Center to the Circumference of the Earth
label: Kemado
description: Nodding toward slowcore, but with a much louder and grittier aesthetic, True Widow play like a mix of stoner-rock and shoegaze.

title: Capsized
label: Natural Selection
description: With elements of math-rock, avant-jazz, and pop, the only consistent thing about Capillary Action is that they'll surprise you.

title: Cotonou Club
label: Strut
description: Two decades after breaking up, this versatile unit from West Africa's Benin returns with some new members and a good deal of their initial creative spark.

title: Harbors
label: Hometapes
description: Volcano Choir and Collections of Colonies of Bees man unveils another stellar project, with vocalists including Justin Vernon of Bon Iver.

title: All Eternals Deck
label: Merge
description: After two previous albums together, the rock trio version of the Mountain Goats now sound like a properly developed unit that plays with nuance and purpose.

title: Other People
label: Atlantic
description: UK synth-pop producer's debut for Atlantic sees a digital-only release-- only after he's quit the project to work under a different guise.

title: Mazes
label: Sacred Bones
description: Second album from this Bay Area psychedelic pop duo-- which features Wooden Shjips' Erik "Ripley" Johnson-- is an exercise in accessibility and concision.

title: Fabric 56
label: Fabric
description: One of the best and most beloved Chicago house producers contributes the latest in Fabric's bi-monthly mix series.

title: Who You Are
label: Lava
description: UK pop star Jessie J is charmless, banal, vapid, and suddenly all over the place.

title: Gimme Some
label: StarTime
description: Still arguably struggling to escape the weight of "Young Folks" and Writer's Block, the affable Swedes return to the sound of their breakthrough LP.

title: Imperfiction
label: Drag City
description: A rare lost album that feels genuinely adrift, this vulnerable, exposed-nerve 1984 release was one of acid-folk's farthest-out relics' comeback album.

title: Defaults
label: Dovecote
description: Chillwave survivors/leftovers release their LP free online to little fanfare, which is too bad since it's a smart, modest affair.

title: You Stand Uncertain
label: Planet Mu
description: This New York-based producer moves fluidly between drum & bass, dubstep, deep house, and UK garage on his latest full-length.

title: Dust Remixes
label: Bpitch Control
description: A diverse cast of producers-- from sound architect Tim Hecker to young upstart Nicolas Jaar to genre vet Aux 88-- take on Ellen Allien's recent LP.

title: Reissues
label: Island
description: This ambitious set of reissues highlights a strange band whose career was as varied and resourceful as any act in rock.

title: Space on Tuesday
label: self-released
description: This UK indie rock band splits time between plodding rock and vibrant, horn-led post-punk throwbacks on their new LP.

label: Not Not Fun
description: Wisconsin dub-pop duo makes decidedly psychedelic music but with a rich tapestry of subtle, almost romantic details.

title: Regifted Light
label: Drag City
description: Former street performer continues her unusual, late-life transition into accomplished professional artist with her best LP yet. Andrew WK produces.

title: Starting From Nowhere
label: Little
description: The "Tim and Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!" stars construct a nearly straight-faced record of tacky 1970s and 80s soft-rock pastiche.

title: W.A.R.
label: Duckdown
description: The golden age rapper follows his excellent 2007 comeback Desire with an album that fits the continuum of his conscious-minded career.

title: Golden Trees
label: Amish
description: Helen Rush joins with other former bandmates for her first outing since the end of her influential folk group Tower Recordings.

title: Labour of Lust [Reissue]
label: Yep Roc
description: Long out of print, the English singer-songwriter's wry pub rock landmark is reissued with some bonus material.

label: Kill Shaman
description: Eccentric french band offers its second album of post-punk accented by strange samples and even some tasteful string arrangements.

title: Common Era
label: Kranky
description: The New Orleans duo's first full-length since 2006's October Language adds vocals and steady rhythms to the dark, ambient mix.

title: Submarine OST
label: Domino
description: On this low-key and intimate soundtrack for a recent indie film, the Arctic Monkeys frontman continues to grow as an artist when away from his primary band.

title: Crack My Bones
label: Southern Fried
description: French production duo with a clutch of remixes to their name step out on a full-length debut that shows their way with hooks and sometimes spotty songcraft.

title: Tan Bajo
label: In the Red
description: Puerto Rican band offers its second album of language-transcending hooks and indecipherably catchy garage pop.

title: Dress Like Your Idols
label: Magic Marker
description: After years on the fringes of the indie rock mainstream, BOAT embrace professionalism in something of an underachiever's quarter-life crisis.

title: FabricLive 56
label: Fabric
description: The busy head of Hessle Audio offers up a forward-looking mix that touches on Burial, MJ Cole and Wiley, Julio Bashmore, and much more.

title: Angles
label: RCA
description: The Strokes return after a lengthy hiatus following the disappointing First Impressions of Earth, and they sound fragmented with a lack of purpose.

title: Boys and Diamonds
label: Kompakt
description: The husband-and-wife duo with an eclectic global sound find a home on revered techno imprint Kompakt but the resulting music is not inspiring.

title: Horizontal Structures
label: Honest Jon's
description: The second studio LP from this austere project finds the Basic Channel producer continuing to work with Sasu Ripatti (aka Vladislav Delay) and adding guests.

title: Helioscope
label: Cuckundoo
description: Leeds quintet pick up the post-rock mantle while managing to stretch its parameters with diverse arrangements and sonics on their second album.

title: Bridge Over Troubled Water
label: Sony
description: The folk-pop duo's classic 1970 swan song is reissued with a DVD containing a television special from that year.

title: Build a Rocket Boys!
label: Polydor
description: Once perennial underdogs and now Mercury Prize winners, Elbow release their first album as a commercial and not just critical force.

title: Approaching the Energy Field
label: Addenda
description: Latest from the versatile, exciting Eternals, one of few current indie bands still paying tribute to common 1990s touchstones such as Sun Ra or King Tubby.

title: Dolphins
label: Thrill Jockey
description: After the departure of their bassist, this San Francisco/NYC-based band has gone in an entirely new direction that favors electronic soundscapes.

title: Lesser Known
label: Carpark
description: Heavily in debt to New Order and 80s synth-pop in general, the latest from Adventure sounds more expansive and maximalistic than the work of his heroes.

title: Mosaik
label: Monkeytown
description: The Berlin-based electronic producer with many singles and remixes to his credit tries a little of everything on his debut LP and mostly succeeds.

title: Several Shades of Why
label: Sub Pop
description: After more than a quarter-century, the Dinosaur Jr. leader releases his first solo album of all original material, and it's an almost entirely acoustic gem.

title: One Nation
label: Hippos in Tanks
description: This shadowy UK outfit brings the ominous, hazy electro-dub and never gives too much away.

title: Pakistan Folk and Pop Instrumentals 1966-1976
label: Sublime Frequencies
description: Sublime Frequencies gathers the lion's share of recorded non-film Pakistani beat music, adding a small, valuable piece to the history of global rock.

title: Blessed
label: Lost Highway
description: Two decades into her career, the singer-songwriter continues to evolve, but here she struggles to transcend cliché.

title: II
label: No Quarter
description: Six years after the huge noise-rock of their last LP, this New York band returns with a record just as heavy but even more widescreen.

title: Lasers
label: Atlantic
description: A huge misstep, Lupe Fiasco's new LP simply sounds bad, playing against every single one of his strengths and creating new weaknesses.

title: Summer Echoes
label: Morr
description: Latest from this Icelandic Morr act is  layered and lush, with electronic filigree laid atop orchestrated psychedelia laid atop acoustic indie-folk.

title: Sauna
label: R&S
description: Blending the escapism of dream-pop with the crisp beats of two-step, Vondelpark invoke nostalgia from two distinct places-- one imagined and one lived.

title: A Dream a While Back
label: Drag City
description: The third chapter in this psych-folk vet's musical story is a prequel of sorts, as Drag City gathers a short collection of songs recorded back in 1970-71.

title: DJ-Kicks
label: !K7
description: Two of America's top new production teams bring their hip-hop and R&B-flecked house sound to the venerable DJ-Kicks series.

title: Shaolin vs. Wu-Tang
label: Ice H2O
description: Neither as ambitious nor as dark as his triumphant Cuban Linx II, Rae's latest is still unmistakably a Wu-Tang record. Rick Ross and Nas guest.

title: Electric Endicott
label: Western Vinyl
description: A sort of proto Ariel Pink, Gary Wilson earned a cult by offering a skewed take on saccharine AM pop in the late 1970s. He now finally issues another album.

title: Dead Reckoning
label: Badman
description: Portland. Old-timey garb. Songs about trains and rivers. Nasal vocals. Yup, these guys will appeal to Decemberists fans.

title: Last Night on Earth
label: Island
description: After making their name with the sort of precious, retch-inducing indie currently soundtracking car ads, this Etsy-pop group broadens its horizons and scope.

title: James Brown: The Singles, Volume Ten: 1975-1979
label: Hip-O Select
description: James Brown: The Disco Years. You also get two versions of a University of Georgia football theme-- the perils of being comprehensive.

title: No Color
label: Frenchkiss
description: After the move toward genial folk-pop on their misstep of a third album, Dodos return to the formula that made Visiter so successful.

title: Build With Erosion
label: Team Love
description: Cut-and-paste indie duo move from post-rock to tightly editing decayed or decaying sonic fragments into shuffling, uneasy musical statements.

title: Riot Now!
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Chicago's Eleventh Dream Day continue to be first-wave, American indie rock survivors; this is their first album in five years.

title: The Big Roar
label: Atlantic
description: The Welsh band with Britpop-sized ambition offers its long-awaited full-length and it includes re-worked tracks from last year's mini album.

title: Civilian
label: Merge
description: This Baltimore duo sand the edges between quiet and loud, gentle and rough, hard and soft, clean and dirty, and make their best LP in the process.

title: Island Brothers
label: Drag City
description: A two-song 10" to benefit Haiti also features Will Oldham's recent project in fine form.

title: In Tension EP
label: self-released
description: On their four-song debut EP, this Brooklyn duo have a way of channeling the dark new wave of the 1980s without seeming like a re-tread.

title: Telling the Truth
label: Numero Group
description: Numero Group issues an LP from this obscure soul singer and it's a highly creative and listenable assimilation of soul, pop, rock, and folk signifiers.

title: 100 Lovers
label: Anti-
description: The curiously popular indie rock band sheds its remaining punk tendencies for a more ambitious, pop-driven effort.

title: Absolute
label: Virgin
description: This career-spanning best-of from Green Gartside's influential avant-pop project reveals the depth of his vision and keen intelligence in a succinct package.

title: A Tale of Two Journeys
label: Modular
description: Released as a promo mixtape in conjunction with the excellent Zonoscope, A Tale of Two Journeys is filled with music that inspired that album.

title: Cartagena! Curro Fuentes & The Big Band Cumbia And Descarga Sound Of Colombia 1962-1972
label: Soundway
description: The UK-based Soundway label offers up a sharp overview of the jazzy styles bubbling up in Colombia during this fertile period.

title: Social Experiment 002
label: No. 19 Music
description: Fast-rising techno stars Soul Clap kick off what will surely be a big year for them with this mix of like-minded, new, North American producers.

title: Cervantine
label: Unknown
description: Jeremy Barnes and Heather Trost continue to explore Balkan folk-inspired music, adding sounds from Greece and even their New Mexico home.

title: Asleep on the Floodplain
label: Drag City
description: The restless avant-folk songwriter Ben Chasny returns with a record that distills his obessions into a coherent whole.

title: Collapse Into Now
label: Warner Bros.
description: Their first LP since the 1997 departure of Bill Berry that sounds unmistakably like themselves, this is also R.E.M.'s best record in that time.

title: The Invisible Insurrection
label: Fauxpas Musik
description: Dubstep formalists rejoice: Here's a studied and meditative take on the UK bass sound that has proved especially difficult to replicate.

title: What a Pleasure EP
label: Captured Tracks
description: More muted indie pop from the Brooklyn band, and this time they've teamed with kindred spirit Jack Tatum of Wild Nothing for a track.

title: SMM: Context
label: Ghostly
description: Ghostly celebrates the rich post-ambient field with this look at today's top minimalists, including Peter Broderick, Svarte Greiner, and Kyle Bobby Dunn.

title: Constant Future
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Brooklyn trio continue to blend noise and melody, using Lightning Bolt's sonic sensibility in the service of  huge, meaty, cathartic songs.

title: Queens of the Stone Age [Reissue]
label: Rekords
description: Stoner rock heroes Kyuss first morphed into the more melodic, loose-limbed variation of themselves, QOTSA, on this self-titled debut, now reissued.

title: The Color
label: Royal Potato Family
description: Member of Boston's eclectic pop group Apollo Sunshine heads out on his own with an album of melodic rock tinged with country.

title: First Wave
label: Wichita
description: Featuring two previously UK-only EPs and five new tracks, this set is a comprehensive introduction to the Glaswegian producer.

title: The House Of Friendly Ghosts, Vol. 1
label: JDub
description: Balkan Beat Box member adds Malian and Tuareg influences to his already eclectic style. Colin Stetson and members of Arcade Fire, YYYs, and Antibalas guest.

title: Slaughterhouse EP
label: E1
description: Newly signed to Eminem's Shady Records, the hip-hop collective releases a stopgap EP to piggyback off this bit of positive PR.

title: Smoke Ring For My Halo
label: Matador
description: Kurt Vile's fourth full-length may also be his best, as it distills classic American guitar music into one singular and sublime vision.

title: um, uh oh
label: Barsuk
description: Injecting some blues into his latest release, Eric Elbogen continues to settle comfortably into indie pop middle age.

title: The Woody Nightshade
label: Strange Attractors Audio House
description: The singer-songwriter with a penchant for gloomy folk returns with a richly collaborative album that focuses on love and loss.

title: Bible Eyes
label: Night Slugs
description: Toronto-based producer affiliated with London's Night Slugs label steps out with a strong full-length debut engineered for headphones and dancefloors alike.

title: Nostalgia, Ultra.
label: self-released
description: After languishing on Island Def Jam, this Odd Future member and Justin Bieber songwriter (!) put out his debut R&B LP for free via Tumblr.

title: iTunes Live from SoHo
label: 4AD
description: Recorded the week of Halcyon Digest's release at the SoHo Apple Store, this 42-minute document is far from a tossed-off affair.

title: Gramahawk
label: self-released
description: Following a more ambitious turn on 2009's All of Us in Our Night, this Athens, Ga., band returns to the confines of hooky indie rock.

title: Trash Hit
label: God Mode
description: This tight, heavy band carries an intense physicality that comes off like an indictment of indie's dazed wistfulness and polite, fussy arrangements.

title: New History Warfare Vol. 2: Judges
label: Constellation
description: Michigan-born, Montreal-based saxophonist crafts a unique modern jazz record with both mind-boggling technique and in-the-moment expression.

title: Fading Parade
label: Sub Pop
description: Papercuts' Jason Quever, who started a folkier relative to friends and tourmates Grizzly Bear and Beach House, offers his Sub Pop debut and best LP yet.

title: Wounded Rhymes
label: Atlantic
description: Swedish star follows her Youth Novels with another record that captures the complex, contradictory, and intense yearning of young adulthood.

title: Laru Beya
label: Next Ambience
description: Aurelio Martinez stakes a claim as the Garifuna's top cultural ambassador, picking up the late Andy Palacio's baton and running with it on this Sub Pop LP.

title: Uncut Diamond EP
label: Partisan
description: Another new band exploring dark synth-pop, shoegaze, and goth-rock-- led by Paul Duncan, an associate of Grizzly Bear and Bear in Heaven-- makes its debut.

title: Leaves Eclipse the Light / The Motion Makes Me Last
label: Temporary Residence
description: These two brief EPs from ambient-leaning producer Matthew Cooper are a mix of old and new tracks, remixes, and video.

title: Departing
label: Saddle Creek
description: Sophomore effort from the folk-rock trio plays as the wintertime counterpart to their debut's prairie summer.

title: Synthesist
label: Rvng Intl.
description: This fine album of early synthesizer music, originally released in 1980, is now reissued with a companion disc of reworkings by OPN, Arp, and more.

title: A Pre-Existing Condition
label: Ghostmeat
description: An inspiration to and then a protégé of Conor Oberst, David Dondero's latest finds him getting away from Team Love, electric guitars, and himself.

title: Mind Spiders
label: Dirtnap
description: Mark Ryan of Denton, Texas band Marked Men offers this side-project debut, a balanced garage-rock album that pulls no punches.

title: Tear the Fences Down
label: Dangerbird
description: Eulogies' third record becomes something of a eulogy itself, crafted after the death of a friend's four-year-old boy.

title: Anna Calvi
label: Domino
description: From a lineage that includes Edith Piaf and PJ Harvey-- and with celeb fans like Brian Eno and Nick Cave-- this goth-pop singer makes her debut.

title: He Gets Me High EP
label: Sub Pop
description: Dum Dum Girls continue to branch out on this EP, proving the band's musical palette is larger and more sophisticated than most of their peers'.

title: Discodeine
label: Dirty
description: French dance producers Pilooski and Pentile recruit Pulp's Jarvis Cocker and Matias Aguayo to help flesh out their debut dance-pop LP.

title: Peer Amid
label: Thrill Jockey
description: The Swedish noise rock/post-punk outfit here team with former Lungfish frontman Daniel Higgs and the results are predictably intense and hypnotic.

title: Something Dirty
label: Bureau B
description: One of two projects called Faust and featuring members of the 70s Krautrock pioneers offers a new entry into the group's oddly complex discography.

title: The Best of Gloucester County
label: Sounds Familyre
description: After a long wait, Daniel Smith-- patriarch of the Danielson Famile, a longstanding collaborator and pal to Sufjan Stevens-- finally returns.

title: Computers and Blues
label: Atlantic
description: Mike Skinner says goodbye to his Streets project with an attempted return to the sound of his landmark 2002 debut, Original Pirate Material.

title: Too Beautiful to Work
label: Dead Oceans
description: The Canadian quartet expands its horizons and sound on its Dead Oceans debut. Owen Pallett, Colin Stetson, and Arcade Fire's Sarah Neufeld guest.

title: Thrawn
label: Domino
description: Scottish singer-songwriter who, since 1995, has recorded and self-released over 40 full-lengths on his own label has his best compiled here for Domino.

title: Special Herbs: The Box Set Vol. 0-9
label: Nature Sounds
description: This box set collects instrumentals released under MF Doom's production alias and shows the depth and range of his beat style.

title: Passive Aggressive: Singles 2002-2010
label: Labrador
description: After 2010 breakthrough Clinging to a Scheme LP, Sweden's the Radio Dept. return with a strong career overview based on their varied singles output.

title: Underneath the Pine
label: Carpark
description: Underneath the Pine finds Chaz Bundick largely shedding his synth-pop roots in favor of a vastly expanded instrumental palette.

title: Buy the Ticket, Take the Ride
label: Mexican Summer
description: Australian band's 2009 LP, which taps into grimy shoegaze in the mode of early Black Rebel Motorcycle Club, gets a stateside issue.

title: Werkschau
label: Bpitch Control
description: A totem for Berlin and for the pop-influenced wing of techno and microhouse, Ellen Allien's BPitch Control shows off its wares with this comp.

title: Gone Blind EP
label: Acéphale
description: London-via-Italy transplant Mauro Remiddi (Sunny Day Sets Fire) follows a year of releasing a series of low-key EPs with his project's proper debut.

title: Return to the Ugly Side
label: Domino
description: The Bristol outfit mentored by Portishead's Geoff Barrow moves from an album that was a patchwork references to one that feels like a seamless whole.

title: The King of Limbs
label: XL
description: Radiohead's latest album is their shortest to date, offering eight new tracks that feel like small but natural evolutions of previously explored directions.

title: Songs From a Toxic Apartment
label: self-released
description: Bedroom producer, artist, and Elvis Perkins associate navigates emotional and literal toxicity on his new LP.

title: Discontinued Perfume
label: Hometapes
description: Five albums in, the Caribbean still have an ability to make conventional indie rock into something strange and hard to pin down.

title: The Past, the Present, and the Possible
label: Human Sounds
description: French veterans are still hunting around the same fertile, bouncy, buffed-to-a-high-gloss indie pop ground that birthed Phoenix.

title: Bootleg Volume 2: From Memphis to Hollywood
label: Legacy
description: The second volume in Columbia's bootleg series, which collects demos and rarities, is a reminder of Johnny Cash's humble beginnings and 60s curios.

title: The Magic Place
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: The Brooklyn-based singer adds new wrinkles to a sound based on looped and layered voices, and the result is flat-out gorgeous.

title: Fish Touch
label: Error Broadcast
description: Moscow producer with an ear for dubstep and Nintendo bloops offers up a mix of original tracks and remixes.

title: No Witch
label: Jagjaguwar
description: On their third album-- and first since leaving Matador for Jagjaguwar-- this Seattle folk-pop outfit lets a little more darkness into their sound.

title: Magic Trick / Bad Blood EP
label: Captured Tracks
description: Fresh & Onlys frontman Tim Cohen remains as prolific and consistent as ever, with the separate-but-simultaneous release of a new LP and EP.

title: The Gathering
label: Thrill Jockey
description: Once a very good folk-rock band, here Arbouretum embrace fuzz-rock, groove, and other desert-rock approaches.

title: We're New Here
label: XL
description: The xx producer and percussionist Jamie Smith takes a stab at recontextualizing Gil Scott-Heron's excellent 2010 album, I'm New Here.

title: Replicants
label: Old Flame
description: Florida chillwave artist follows last year's Be So True EP with a higher-fidelity LP that aims for the rafters but falls somewhat short.

title: Banjo or Freakout
label: Memphis Industries
description: Working best as an ambient record first and a pop album second, Banjo or Freakout's long-awaited debut is reminiscent of Atlas Sound and Panda Bear.

title: Swagga Fresh Freddie
label: self-released
description: The sonic architect behind Baton Rouge's Trill Ent. keeps cranking out elastic throwback bangers, developing a seriously infectious rap style all his own.

title: Hotel Shampoo
label: Wichita
description: Super Furry Animals frontman offers his third solo album, which opens byways back to the songcraft he so expertly mastered with his main band.

title: Simon Werner a Disparu OST
label: SYR
description: Latest SYR experimental release is a collection of amorphous instrumental sketches created for director Fabrice Gobert's high school mystery film.

title: VWETO
label: Mello
description: Indie soul star continues her engaging and eclectic career with her first instrumental album.

title: You Today
label: Wierd
description: Another in a line of coldwave revivalists-- think Cold Cave or Led Er Est-- this Brooklyn-based composer is here more archivist than visionary.

title: Complex Housing
label: Friends of Friends
description: Paul Salva, head of SF-area label Frite Nite, distills most of what is great about contemporary bass music into his impressive debut LP.

title: Go-Go Boots
label: ATO
description: The Southern gothic band explores small-town violence, wry self-deprecation, and character sketches on its latest record.

title: Ravedeath, 1972
label: Kranky
description: A decade into a career that found him perfecting an immediately recognizable approach to dark ambience, Tim Hecker makes what could be his best record.

title: We Live in Rented Rooms
label: Merge
description: Singer-songwriter F.M. Cornog returns with an album that is typically downcast but less bitter and also perhaps his highest-fi LP to date.

title: The Art of the 12"
label: Union Square
description: The legendary avant-pop label ZTT has many of its top extended mixes collected, including tracks from Propaganda, Grace Jones, FGTH, and the Art of Noise.

title: Headbangers in Ecstasy
label: Mexican Summer
description: The former Pearl Harbor issues their first LP as Puro Instinct; it needs more headbanging and/or ecstasy.

title: Demo
label: Dog Daze
description: The demo that landed Marnie Stern a KRS record deal is now commercially available as a cassette/digital release on the tiny Dog Daze Tapes label.

title: Space Is Only Noise
label: Circus Company
description: The young techno producer with a heavy Villalobos influence and strong singles and remixes to his name crafts a weird and wonderful debut LP.

title: Love and Death
label: Strut
description: A leading light of Ghana's guitar highlife and Afrobeat scenes during the 1970s returns with his first-ever international release.

title: 12 Desperate Straight Lines
label: Merge
description: Telekinesis' latest set of spirited power pop has some of the project's strongest, catchiest tunes to date.

title: Fluorescence
label: Polyvinyl
description: Latest from the shoegaze group conjures a specific slice of the 90s, where cushy, post-MBV textures meet feminine vocals and slick alt-radio production.

title: Dynamite Steps
label: Sub Pop
description: After a successful career-spanning tour, Greg Dulli fittingly returns with an album that resurrects his favorite themes and noir-rock sounds.

title: Hardcore Will Never Die, But You Will
label: Sub Pop
description: On their latest record, the Scottish post-rock heroes sidestep some pitfalls from recent releases and sound like they're enjoying being themselves again.

title: Roachy Balboa Round 2
label: Goomba
description: The sequel to the promising Roachy Balboa tape finds Roach Gigz brimming with creative ideas; perhaps too many at once.

title: Kudos
label: Fire
description: This NZ band is still preoccupied by 80s/90s college rock but is drifting into a slightly hazier direction-- toward Spacemen 3, Stereolab, and Bailter Space.

title: Degeneration Street
label: Dangerbird
description: Dears founder Murray A. Lightburn continues to persevere after his band nearly split, and here he delivers a record with lofty aims and goals.

title: Yuck
label: Fat Possum
description: This new London quartet's debut puts a personal and affecting spin on an array of alt- and indie rock influences from the 1980s and 90s.

title: Let England Shake
label: Vagrant
description: The always-unpredictable singer-songwriter returns with a haunting and beautiful meditation on war that ranks with her finest records.

title: O Moon, Queen of Night on Earth
label: Vapor
description: This album from the proto-indie star extends a remarkable series of low-key, mostly acoustic releases for Neil Young's Vapor label.

title: Free Gucci II: The Burrrtish Edition
label: Mad Decent
description: Sinden-- following Diplo's lead last year-- compiles a mix of radically reconfigured Gucci Mane tunes via the frayed ends of England's beat music scene.

title: End It All
label: Anticon
description: Anti-Pop Consortium auteur makes his anticon. debut with an LP that features TVOTR's Tunde Adebimpe, Four Tet, Interpol's Sam Fogarino, and Tobacco.

title: La Sera
label: Hardly Art
description: Vivian Girls bassist Katy Goodman uses simplicity as an airy foundation for her lovelorn twee-pop songs on this side project.

title: The People's Key
label: Saddle Creek
description: Conor Oberst retires the Bright Eyes moniker with an LP that sees him returning to Nebraska to record but eschewing Americana and attic-pop for sunnier sounds.

title: Tell Me
label: Nonesuch
description: Neo-country talent matches and even surpasses her impressive debut with this effort. Black Keys' Dan Auerbach produces and guests.

title: Invariable Heartache
label: City Slang
description: Lambchop's Kurt Wagner and neo-country leader Cortney Tidwell pay tribute to her parents' semi-obscure label, Chart Records.

title: Inglorious Bastard (Prelude to Valkyrie)
label: Maybach
description: The Waka to Rick Ross' Gucci Mane delivers exuberant ridiculousness on-par with his boss on this excellent mixtape.

title: Riddimentary: Diplo Selects Greensleeves
label: VP
description: In an uncharacteristically focused mix, Diplo digs into the early-1980s period when roots reggae was transforming into dancehall.

title: Tao of the Dead
artist: ...And You Will Know Us by the Trail of Dead
label: Richter Scale
description: Latest from the hardcore-prog band runs the thematic gamut from the death of rock radio to the work of comparative mythologist Joseph Campbell.

title: TRE3S
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Mexico City's leading indie rock band takes traces of 90s groups like Built to Spill and Modest Mouse but are a unique, singular project.

title: You Are the Beat
label: Kanine
description: Slick, competent, and appropriately bookish, the latest entry into the post-Slumberland revival indie pop sweepstakes issues its debut LP.

title: Lovers Holiday
label: Warner Bros.
description: The stylish rapper with an 80s indie fetish follows a mixtape with a proper EP, and here everything seems to be in place except for the music.

title: Seefeel
label: Warp
description: The massively creative and formative UK band releases its first LP since 1996. Boredoms drummer Iida Kazuhisa guests.

title: Well Spent Youth
label: Pampa
description: The German minimal house producer returns for his first full-length since 2005's We Are Monster and his sound is as distinctive as ever.

title: Divine EP
label: Interscope
description: The Baltimore club producer who has worked with M.I.A. and Rye Rye steps out with a less frenetic and more experimental release.

title: We're Here to Help
label: Prophase
description: This Philly group skated on the edges of post-punk and no wave in the late 1970s, releasing just one 7". Thurston Moore shepherds their surprise comeback LP.

title: Cyanide Sisters EP
label: Ghostly
description: Seth Haley's most closeup-friendly project is remastered and re-packaged alongside four new bonus tracks by venerable label Ghostly.

title: Shapeshifting
label: Paper Bag
description: After a few lackluster indie records, this Montreal group decamp to Paper Bag Records for a pulsing, lush LP produced by Studio's Dan Lissvik.

title: James Blake
label: A&M
description: After a brilliant run of EPs, James Blake returns with an album that tilts toward traditional songwriting while refining his unique approach to production.

title: Hello
label: Hello Echo
description: Apollo Sunshine guitarist Sean Aylward heads this indie trio, whose debut LP finds tension between the pastoral and the urban.

title: The Babies
label: Shrimper
description: This side project of Woods' bassist Kevin Morby and Cassie Ramone of Vivian Girls veers between exceeding the sum of its parts and falling far short.

title: Selbstportrait / Selbstportrait II
label: Bureau B
description: The co-founder of seminal kosmische bands Cluster and Harmonia, Roedelius has two of his records reissued just as their sound is enjoying a comeback.

title: Violet Cries
label: Matador
description: Matador's entry into the 2011 goth-pop sweepstakes enlists the xx producer Rodaidh McDonald for their highly anticipated debut LP.

title: Akron/Family II: The Cosmic Birth and Journey of Shinju TNT
label: Dead Oceans
description: The strange, compelling new Akron LP was said to be written next to a Japanese volcano and recorded in an abandoned Detroit train station.

title: HONORS
label: Sounds Familyre
description: Husband and wife indie-folk duo inject actions and situations that might seem banal with wonder and intrigue.

title: Step in Shadows
label: Young Turks
description: After remixing M.I.A., Basement Jaxx, Mark Ronson, and Underworld, this masked producer unleashes his latest pan-electronic LP.

title: Rare Forms
label: Lefse
description: Taking quite a few cues from Feels-era Animal Collective, this Lefse band delivers its sophomore album.

title: Angels of Darkness, Demons of Light 1
label: Southern Lord
description: After two more personnel changes-- including the addition of Karl Blau on bass-- Earth return with a fresh context and complex, counterintuitive choices.

title: Zonoscope
label: Modular
description: Three years on from In Ghost Colours, Cut Copy return with a powerful new album that's less about anthems and more about movements and transitions.

title: Baby How Can It Be? Songs of Love, Lust and Contempt From the 1920s and 1930s
label: Dust-to-Digital
description: John Heneghan of East River String Band offers a compilation of diverse and wide-ranging music from the 1920s and 30s.

title: Friends For Now
label: Kanine
description: One of a few bands aiming to replace Women as the go-to group for shadowy, reverb-smothered guitar rock unleashes its debut LP.

title: 100 Records Volume II: I Miss the Jams
label: Turn Up
description: SF rock fixture recently constructed a handbuilt jukebox jammed with 100 songs recorded with help from a coterie of the Bay Area's garage-pop artists.

title: Until the Light of Morning
label: Light of Morning
description: New York-based English singer-songwriter offers an album of lullabies crafted for her new-parent friends.

title: Nowhere [20th Anniversary Edition]
label: Rhino
description: One of the indisputable masterpieces of shoegaze is given the expanded reissue it deserves, with bonus tracks, a live show, and detail-sharp remastering.

title: Stars Have Shapes
label: Delmark
description: The collective led by trumpeter/cornetist Rob Mazurek returns with a heady mix of free and traditional jazz, ambient electronics, and musique concrète.

title: Wuppdeckmischmampflow
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt's latest mix is less about the Now as it is just plain gorgeous, a wonderful slice of richly detailed home-listening techno.

title: This Frontier EP
label: Obscura
description: Morgan Kibby, who sang on M83's Saturdays=Youth, continues that record's blissful retro-homage on her solo project, White Sea.

title: Young the Giant
label: Roadrunner
description: Debut from California quintet seems like a label's calculated effort to capture indie rock's sound and commercial momentum yet include none of its spirit.

title: Rolling Blackouts
label: Memphis Industries
description: Brighton's the Go! Team show signs of evolution on album #3, as their stylistic range broadens ever so slightly.

title: We Are the Lilies
label: V2
description: Os Mutantes' Sérgio Dias teams with 70s pop revivalists Tahiti Boy and the Palmtree Family for an album that appropriates both musicians' styles.

title: Party Store
label: In the Red
