title: Sometimes the Blues Is Just a Passing Bird EP
label: Dead Oceans
description: Neither a sequel nor a satellite to this year's The Wild Hunt, the Tallest Man on Earth's new EP is slightly darker, muted, and meditative.

title: Grinderman 2
label: Anti-
description: Nick Cave's schizophrenic and sloppy mid-life crisis project, Grinderman, returns with another album of feral urges and ferocious guitar work.

title: Lights From Paradise
label: Tee Pee
description: Less stoner rock than stoned rock, QFF's sophomore album is raucous, texturally rich, and whimsical.

title: Man Alive
label: Geffen
description: Future Mercury Prize contenders continue to make it difficult for us to take UK hypes very seriously.

title: Album of the Year
label: Decon
description: Detroit underground hip-hop star comes to grips with his particularly difficult 2009 on this deeply determined LP.

title: Pop Negro
label: Young Turks
description: A huge influence on the summery and Balearic sounds in indie over the past two years, Barcelona's El Guincho returns with his sophomore album.

title: False Priest
label: Polyvinyl
description: Kevin Barnes delivers more ambitious psych-pop in the vein of Hissing Fauna or Skeletal Lamping, here with help from Jon Brion and Janelle Monáe.

title: This Alone Above All Else in Spite of Everything
label: Kranky
description: Welcome back to another record from doom-folk machine Mat Sweet's morally ambivalent universe of violence, despair, and loveliness.

title: The Vaselines: Sex with an X
label: Sub Pop
description: The Glasgow duo of Frances McKee and Eugene Kelly-- feted by Nirvana, backed here by members of Belle and Sebastian-- release their first LP since 1989.

title: Memphis
label: True Panther
description: Memphis indie pop band follows top singles "Hey Boy" and "Superball" with an album of first kisses and Brian Wilson-like melodies.

title: Penny Sparkle
label: 4AD
description: Longtime NYC band suspends its Sonic Youth and MBV worship and makes a record of all pillowy electro-balladry.

title: Interpol
label: Matador
description: Interpol re-group on Matador and record a bleak, depressive album about disillusionment and being at the end of one's rope.

title: Fin Eaves
label: Holy Mountain
description: The drone-pop band returns with its fourth proper album, which mixes blasts of noise with more melodic elements.

title: On the Bright Side
label: Phthalo
description: Sasu Ripatti (Luomo, Vladislav Delay) issues a record of the analog, bleeps-and-bass sound that characterized UK rave at the start of the 90s.

title: 7AM
label: Merok
description: Creators of one the songs of the year, "Cheaters", this duo-- like James Blake or How to Dress Well-- craft hazy, homemade versions of pop, R&B, and dance.

title: Senior
label: Wall of Sound
description: Just 18 months after the effervescent electro-pop of Junior, Röyksopp return with an all-instrumental follow-up.

title: Lisbon
label: Fat Possum
description: On their sixth studio LP, the Walkmen use mariachi horns and echoes of 1950s production styles to realize their wounded, anxious, and affecting songs.

title: No Ghost
label: Bella Union
description: On their latest the Canadian folk-rockers show a flair for ballads and an ear for textures but struggle to articulate an original voice.

title: Tomorrow Morning
label: E Works
description: E returns with another exercise in self-referentiality and self-indulgences.

title: Pope Killdragon
label: eMusic
description: Confessional singer-songwriter abandons the personal tragedies that inspired his debut in favor of an astoundingly original twist on the loner-folk template.

title: Bitches Brew [Legacy Edition]
label: Sony
description: One of the most unfuckwithable records of the 20th century gets another pair of reissue releases, the better of the two being this Legacy Edition.

title: Body Talk Pt. 2
label: Interscope
description: Robyn releases the middle part of her Body Talk trilogy, here tabling some of her forays into the offbeat and sticking with her pure pop wheelhouse.

title: The Soft Wave
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: After pre-dating the rise of artists like Emeralds and Oneohtrix Point Never, Arp's drone gets a shot of songcraft and traditional instrumentation.

title: Live at Roadburn 2007
label: Neurot
description: The epic kings of doom and sludge, a huge influence on this century's metal, release their first official live record.

title: Kilimanjaro
label: Kompakt
description: One of Kompakt's cornerstone artists returns to making slow, bleary, moody, spooky sounds just as they find favor in the U.S. electro-pop underground.

title: Wilderness Heart
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Stephen McBean's boogie outfit makes a more concerted effort to reconcile the band's inner darkness and light, leaning as much on pop as psych.

title: We Have Remixes EP
label: Astralwerks
description: The electro-pop band has tracks from One Life Stand reworked by house hero Todd Edwards, Caribou's Dan Snaith, and techno hotshot Osborne.

title: Afro-Beat Airways: West African Shock Waves, Ghana & Togo 1972-1978
label: Analog Africa
description: The tireless Analog Africa label heads to Ghana and Togo to explore the area's tight-knit 1970s funk scene.

title: We Can't Fly
label: PIAS
description: Apparently, "artistic differences" wasn't a bullshit reason for this potentially giant dance duo's recent breakup: Their debut LP is all over the place.

title: The Last Call
label: self-released
description: Mixtape star and B.o.B. associate fortunately hasn't switched up his style, or lost his creative spark, on his latest release.

title: Minotaur
label: Merge
description: The UK cult act continues to draw from 60s soft-pop yet adds off-kilter twists-- a spoken-word, musique concrète ghost tale-- on this mini-LP.

title: Personal Life
label: Kill Rock Stars
description: The pop-punkers are a bit less frantic as they turn their attention from politics to affairs of the heart, and the results are mixed.

title: Machines Hate Me
label: Alpha Pup
description: L.A. hip-hop producer combines 80s chiptunes with the -bumper hip-hop breaks that are currently his hometown sound.

title: O
label: Thrill Jockey
description: The deluge of material from the long-dormant electronic experimentalist continues with a 2xCD set that builds on the new sound unveiled on his Oh EP.

title: The Capitol Years: 1995-2007
label: Capitol
description: This sporadically successful glam-pop band's stint on a major label is traced from start to finish.

title: I'm Having Fun Now
label: Warner Bros.
description: Sure to garner comparisons to She & Him, Jenny Lewis' collab with boyfriend and folk troubadour Jonathan Rice is rougher, tougher, and more rock'n'roll.

title: All Delighted People EP
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: Ahead of his October LP, Sufjan Stevens issues an hour-plus "EP" that seems to accommodate a grab bag of disparate ideas and familiar sounds.

title: Nothing Else
label: Brainfeeder
description: Lorn's debut on Flying Lotus' label is 30 minutes of beat-driven bangers with very few zeitgeist-capturing gimmicks to be found.

title: Modern Rituals
label: Domino
description: NY-via-California band exhibits a bicoastal sound that keeps them from being beholden to any single style.

title: Hood Pass Intact EP
label: Stones Throw
description: This four-song EP from the prolific producer features re-worked cuts from the Toeachizown series along with new material.

title: Jewelry Selection
label: self-released
description: After a relatively sedate, lyrics-focused tape, Gucci Mane returns to the more musically dynamic, multi-dimensional approach of his 2007-09 work.

title: Familial
label: Nonesuch
description: Radiohead drummer goes acoustic guitar-strumming singer-songwriter, putting his sticks down to pen Nick Drakesian songs about family.

title: Ullakkopalo
label: Fonal
description: Finland's Fonal, a leading label in the psych and freak folk worlds, releases another dense tapestry of electro-acoustic sound from Jan Anderzén.

title: The Metallic Year
label: Thrill Jockey
description: UK guitarist/tape manipulator Alexander Tucker and New Zealandic cohort Daniel Beban explore intersection of drone and doom metal for Thrill Jockey.

title: The Waves
label: Mexican Summer
description: This Bay Area duo that recalls Glasser and Wild Nothing makes an assured Mexican Summer debut.

title: Jesu: Pale Sketches Demixed
label: Ghostly
description: Justin Broadrick's latest EP finds him adopting the Pale Sketcher alias in order to remix his Jesu odds-and-ends compilation of the same name.

title: Surfing the Void
label: Polydor
description: Nu-rave avatars follow an oddly overhyped and underrated LP by shaving some pop and art leanings and coming across as a fully formed rock band.

title: Disko
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Rune Grammofon and Smalltown Supersound associate Kim Hiorthøy enlists a full band for a project that recalls his previous work.

title: Barbara
label: PIAS
description: Popular in the UK and basically ignored at home, We Are Scientists have now enlisted a Razorlight member for their latest LP of lukewarm indie-dance.

title: Total 11
label: Kompakt
description: Kompakt's flagship compilation series returns with new tracks from the Field, Jürgen Paape, Superpitcher, and Michael Mayer.

title: 1,000 Grams Vol. 1
label: CTE
description: Coke-rap star's latest high-profile mixtape is characterized primarily by a potential feud brewing between himself and Rick Ross.

title: The Electronic Anthology Project
label: self-released
description: Built to Spill have a little fun with their own catalog by covering their own songs in the style of 1980s synth-pop. Seriously!

title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World OST
label: ABKCO
description: The big-screen adaptation of the popular comic enlists Beck, Broken Social Scene, and Metric to stand in for its fictionalized bands.

title: Without Why
label: Scarlett
description: Former Pipettes singer trades girl-group conceits for lovelorn and wistful indie pop, with help from backing band the Distractions.

title: That Mystic EP
label: Night Slugs
description: Rave throwback producer branches out to explore dubstep and R&B on his new EP and keeps up his perfect hit-to-miss ratio in the process.

title: The Orchard
label: Barsuk
description: Pals from Vampire Weekend's Class of '08, the similarly preppy band returns with a sophomore album that pushes their stylistic range at the cost of hooks.

title: Thank You For Your Love EP
label: Rough Trade
description: Antony Hegarty returns with a teaser from his new album, covers of Bob Dylan and John Lennon, and two other originals.

title: Keraaminen Pää
label: Fonal
description: The Finnish psych-folk singer embraces electronics-- icy synth tones, crunchy samples, and abstract gurgles-- on her latest record.

title: Gambling With God
label: Last Gang
description: Toronto band's sound is a throwback to the alt-rock 1990s and they get in just enough catchy riffs to pull it off.

title: DJ /rupture Presents CIAfrica
label: Dutty Artz
description: DJ /rupture handpicks and mixes the best tracks from Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, rap group CIAfrica.

title: Year One / Extra Width/Mo' Width [Deluxe]
label: Shout! Factory
description: The JSBX reissues continue with a collection of early recordings and an expanded version of 1993's Extra Width.

title: Special Moves
label: Rock Action
description: Mogwai's first live package-- a concert recording and DVD companion, Burning, with a different tracklist-- finds them in typically outstanding form.

title: Proximity One: Narrative of a City
label: Proximal
description: More of a scene overview than a label one, this collection of L.A. instrumental hip-hop takes cues from g-Funk, dubstep, and Oxnard breaks.

title: Cloak and Cipher
label: Saddle Creek
description: Loosely related to Broken Social Scene, this Montreal band traffics in the same brand of anthemic, proficient indie rock. Arcade Fire's Jeremy Gara guests.

title: All We Grow
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Bon Iver's classically trained percussionist crafts a debut solo record of austere folk and lush sonics.

title: My Name Is Hannibal
label: Stand Up!
description: The debut album from the promising Chicago-based comic gets over on his conversational tone and bizarre observations.

title: Strange Weather, Isn't It?
label: Warp
description: Warp's dance-rock lifers return to basics after the at-times ham-handed, at-times highly effective rockism of 2007's Myth Takes.

title: Royal Toast
label: Cuneiform
description: Combining elements of post-bop jazz and chamber music, the Claudia Quintet have found a unique and engaging hybrid.

title: Consolamentum
label: White Box
description: Former Oceansize guitarist works with broken-backed dirges for guitar, piano, and tape that skulk between ambient, noise, and pure sound art.

title: Sand & Lines: The Georgia Theatre Sessions, May 20th–24th 2008
label: One Percent Press
description: Scaling back instead of simply piling on, this Georgia chamber-pop band's live document is their most well-crafted record yet.

title: Knoxville
label: Thrill Jockey
description: All-star composer/producer Christian Fennesz issues another of his low-key collaborative LPs, here with guitarist David Daniell and drummer Tony Buck.

title: The Week Never Starts Round Here [Deluxe Edition] / Philophobia [Deluxe Edition]
label: Chemikal Underground
description: The unparalleled Scottish band has its first two LPs reissued and expanded, with Peel Sessions and live performances added.

title: Catching a Tiger
label: Fat Possum
description: L.A.-based folkie's debut sees her collaborating with producers of Tom Waits, Modest Mouse, and Band of Horses fame.

title: House of Tongues
label: Friendly Fire
description: Well traveled and practiced indie pop veterans, including former Luna guitarist Sean Eden, share a keen sense of pop history and a kitchen-sink aesthetic.

title: The Budos Band III
label: Daptone
description: The dependable retro funk outft compacts Afrobeat, Latin soul, and James Brown into brief but highly danceable instrumentals.

title: More About Nothing
label: self-released
description: After his major-label flop, Wale returns to the scene of his greatest mixtape success with another "Seinfeld"-referencing collection.

title: Hawk
label: V2
description: Three albums in, this pairing of ex-Belle and Sebastian and Screaming Trees members still feels unlikely, and still sounds quite good.

title: Sad Sour Future
label: Afternoon
description: Iowa indie rock band harkens back to the kind of hooky, brainy indie traditions of Superchunk, Pavement, and Beulah.

title: Kaleide
label: Wichita
description: UK band with a taste for North American indie rock enlists producer John Goodmanson (Sleater-Kinney, Death Cab For Cutie) for their second record.

title: Church With No Magic
label: Warp
description: Formerly known as Pivot, this Warp act also pares back the atmospherics and drift that often blighted their records.

title: Melvins/Isis
label: Hydra Head
description: Isis' final recordings turn out to be contributions to a split 12" with the resurgent Melvins.

title: Shangaan Electro: New Wave Dance Music From South Africa
label: Honest Jon's
description: An almost wholly unrooted and original dance music, this emerging South African sound marries hyper-quick, cheap electronics with soulful vocals.

title: Boy EP
label: Frenchkiss
description: Indie YouTube covers star aims to branch out with his own material on this, his first Frenchkiss EP.

title: Tima Formosa
artist: Oren Ambarchi | Keiji Haino | Jim O'Rourke
label: Black Truffle
description: Three of the world's best sound artists combine for an absorbing record of electroacoustic improvisation.

title: Natural Selections
label: Hometapes
description: Longtime L.A. rock vet (Savage Republic, Medicine) explores his long-loved themes of juxtaposition and electronic exploration on this solo record.

title: Am I Real? EP
label: Gloriette
description: Latest from Ramona Gonzalez, a buzzed-about, L.A.-based musician who records ephemeral, homemade dreambeat music.

title: All's Well That Ends EP
label: Arts & Crafts
description: Welsh indie band reward their sizable cult with a digital-and-vinyl release that pulls together alternate versions of Romance Is Boring tracks.

title: Berghain 04
label: Ostgut Ton
description: Famed Berlin club continues its mix series with a set constructed by one of its residents, and one of the tech-house/minimal axis' leading lights.

title: Atalanta (Acts of God) Volume II
label: Lovely
description: A 20th century composer who should be namechecked along with Terry Riley and Steve Reich, Robert Ashley often turns the marginal and mundane into magic.

title: High and Dry
label: Hot Cars Warp
description: The versatile and prolific drummer crafts a raucous sound akin to a free jazz take on math-tinted groups like Breadwinner or Shellac.

title: All Is Falling
label: Young God
description: Latest from the UK twentysomething, already a renowned figure in the space between folk, classical music, minimalism, and experimentalism.

title: Black City
label: Ghostly
description: The versatile, prolific techno and pop artist crafts a dark, funk-driven record that may be the best of his career.

title: The Cradle
label: Dualtone
description: Following the departure of three band members, the Oxford, Miss., band re-groups and tries to make a new start.

title: House With a Curse
label: Temporary Residence
description: For their third full-length, Coliseum move from metal-oriented Relapse to Temporary Residence and add guests including Will Oldham.

title: Let It Sway
artist: Someone Still Loves You Boris Yeltsin
label: Polyvinyl
description: Blog-rock survivors continue to knock out trend-resistent power-pop. Death Cab for Cutie's Chris Walla produces.

title: See Birds EP
label: Tri Angle
description: An impressive early step from Alec Koone, a 19-year-old college kid crafting slow, gloomy tracks all from samples located online.

title: Root For Ruin
label: Frenchkiss
description: The veteran band takes a victory lap on its latest record, which walks the same path as 2007's relatively polished Let's Stay Friends.

title: Failing Lights
label: Intransitive
description: Mike Connelly of Wolf Eyes and Hair Police trades harsh noise for tense and shadowy atmosphere.

title: Sugar
label: Old Flame
description: Athens band tours with Dinosaur Jr. and the Meat Puppets, and sounds like it on their latest throwback 90s alt-rock record.

title: Light Chasers
label: Earthology
description: The eighth proper album from the environmentally-minded indie rock band from Minnesota showcases them in quirky and eccentric form.

title: Are You My Mother?
label: File Under: Music
description: Debut solo effort by Neko Case's New Pornographers substitute Kathryn Calder puts the spotlight squarely on her singing, often at the expense of songwriting.

title: Trill O.G.
label: Rap-A-Lot
description: Former UGK great continues to plug away as a solo artist after the untimely death of his musical partner, Pimp C.

title: Full House Head
label: No Quarter
description: The "boogie" is ok; the "endless" is a serious problem.

title: Laugh Tracks
label: Captured Tracks
description: The Fresh & Onlys singer extends his prolific songwriting run of fuzz-psych earworms into solo album territory.

title: Outside the Box
label: Tempa
description: The dubstep originator experiments further with pop form, adding collaborations with artists like Murs and La Roux to bass-heavy instrumentals.

title: Transit Transit
label: TBD
description: Despite fans ranging from Trent Reznor to Thom Yorke to the Coen Brothers, this L.A. neo-shoegaze band never crossed over. Six years later, they finally return.

title: All the Waters of the Earth Turn to Blood
label: At a Loss
description: Though they work in the field of doom metal, this Rhode Island-based duo add gospel choirs, harsh noise, and industrial rock to their terrific second LP.

title: Beachcomber's Windowsill
label: 4AD
description: Taking cues from the Kinks and Belle and Sebastian, this Oxford band craft delicately arranged, pastoral guitar pop.

title: Four More Years EP
label: Arcade Sound
description: With a tone palette as rich as anyone working in chillwave, this bedroom producer crafts a promising debut.

title: Alive As You Are
label: Dangerbird
description: After two LPs of neo-shoegaze, Darker My Love dump the delay pedals and noise for acoustic guitars and harmony vocals.

title: Seu Jorge & Almaz
label: Now Again
description: Like The Life Aquatic David Bowie tie-in, this project began a soundtrack collaboration, but Jorge asked the band to assist on an entire covers album.

title: Maximum Balloon
label: DGC
description: TV on the Radio's Dave Sitek opens his address book and recruits bandmates Kyp Malone and Tunde Adebimpe, Karen O, David Byrne, and more for this project.

title: Tiger Flower Circle Sun
label: Ghostly
description: Through self-designed software, Willits is more a manipulator of guitar tones than a guitarist, and his latest is an ode to tones from Tortoise to Fripp.

title: Shannon Stephens
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: The debut LP from the folky singer-songwriter who made her start with Sufjan Stevens in the 1990s band Marzuki is given a re-release.

title: Gold on Gold
label: Plant Music
description: Recalling Junior Boys, Hot Chip, or Cut Copy, this is as satisfying a take on indie-dance as you'll hear until one of those pacesetters drops a new album.

title: Zero With a Bullet
label: Team Love
description: Veteran singer-songwriter and key influence on Conor Oberst continues to have success elude him, a topic he frequents on his new record.

title: Rated R [Deluxe Edition]
label: Interscope
description: QOTSA's second full-length, originally released in 2000 and now available in a deluxe reissue, stands as one of the last great modern hard rock records.

title: Puutarhatrilogia
label: Friendly Fire
description: Finnish dance-pop band can evoke Stereolab or Lykke Li but mostly work with oblique techno references within the framework of numerous sounds.

title: Drifts
label: Paper Bag
description: The tables turn on this prolific remixer, as his Continent LP is re-worked by a roster of fellow Canadians, including Junior Boys.

title: Jungle Music: Mixed With Love: Essential & Unreleased Remixes 1976-1986
label: Strut
description: This 2xCD set collects remixes from the disco producer (including tracks by sometime collaborator Arthur Russell) that helped to define the 12" dance single.

title: Hidden Lands
label: Twosyllable
description: The appealing second album from this Colorado group is a pastoral in the extreme, with drifting textures, whispered vocals, and lyrics about the forest.

title: Str8 Killa EP
label: Decon
description: After two urgent mixtapes, the Indiana rapper releases his first-ever commercially available record, an EP that finds him more comfortable than ferocious.

title: Fortress
label: Modern Art
description: No-frills indie-pop band incorporates outside elements into its sound, but their style-appropriation can come off as posturing. Neon Indian and Chris Chu guest.

title: Where the Messengers Meet
label: Dead Oceans
description: Punishingly monochromatic and near-depressive, the record sounds like someone sitting and dutifully picking at his meal.

title: On the Ones and Threes
label: Merge
description: The quintessential 90s indie rock band returns with its first LP in a decade.

title: The Singles, Vol. 9: 1973-1975
label: Hip-O Select
description: Some of the era's best funk singles are greeted here by mercifully cancelled releases on a comp characterized as much by interesting failures as hits.

title: Jane Birkin et Serge Gainsbourg
label: Light in the Attic
description: Featuring the scandalous hit "Je T'aime", this 1969 LP from the brilliantly original singer-songwriter has aged beautifully.

title: Obadiah
label: Nettwerk
description: Be Good Tanyas singer strikes out on her own, releasing a quietly ambitious record that tiptoes between soft jazz, smoky soul, and austere country.

title: Mind Altar EP
label: Ghostly
description: Pairing two EPs originally released on the Deastro blog, the latest from the electro-pop project heads in a noisier and more psychedelic direction.

title: Spur of the Moments
label: Drag City
description: Drag City unearths material from this lost 1960s combo, whose eclectic work highlights how quickly and rapidly rock was growing at the time.

title: Teflon Don
label: Maybach
description: His first two records were lousy, but Rick Ross has found his niche by presiding over a luxurious rap fantasy out of step with the current moment.

title: Weareallgoingtoburninhell-megamixxx3
label: Gold Dust Media
description: Indie hip-hop great strings together experimental asides, self-contained pieces, and pre-established material into an instrumnetal sonic arc.

title: Dealing in Antiques
label: Matinee
description: This odds-and-ends compilation from the Finnish indie-pop band contains demos, B-sides, covers, and a couple of new tracks.

title: Let Me Shine for You
label: Tri Angle
description: Ascendant outré-dance imprint Tri Angle pays tribute to jailed starlet Lindsay Lohan with a mixtape covering her pop songs (remember those?).

title: K-X-P
label: Smalltown Supersound
description: Annie producer and cohort Timo Kaukolampi heads a trio making delightfully dark disco.

title: Candle to Your Eyes
label: Asthmatic Kitty
description: This shape-shifting band is at its best when synthesizing art-rock and R&B, but they're confident and thoughtful at crafting other sounds as well.

title: The Suburbs
label: Merge
description: On their third LP, Arcade Fire prove they can make grand statements without sounding like they're carrying the weight of the world.

title: The Low Hanging Fruit
label: JDub
description: Singer-songwriter Jesse Rifkin draws inspiration from religion, mixing tales inspired by the Bible with Qawwali drones and Hindu chants.

title: Cloud Seed
label: Planet µ
description: Aggressive and haunting, Jamie Vex'd makes post-dubstep dance music that could soundtrack dystopian Hollywood sci-fi films.

title: That's How We Burn
label: Sub Pop
description: This indie rock grab bag makes for an impressive Sub Pop debut for this veteran Milwaukee band.

title: Moses on a Snail
label: Guided By Voices, Inc.
description: After a recent hot streak, the GBV singer's latest is dusky, dour, and a bit of a retread.

title: Pilot Talk
label: Roc-A-Fella
description: The New Orleans rapper's long and strange career path leads to this lush, languid, and inviting LP.

title: Again and Again
label: Shelflife
description: Following the "Drugs in My Body" single, synth-pop band Thieves Like Us issues their sophomore LP.

title: Hunting My Dress
label: Vanguard
description: Rising folkie moves from California to Manchester and blends British pastoral folk into her American blues and roots music. Elbow's Guy Garvey guests.

title: Constellations
label: self-released
description: Bedroom indie-pop outfit returns with more studio polish but a lyrical plainness that sadly keeps the band from matching their peers just yet.

title: Neu! Box Set
label: Grönland
description: This vinyl-only set contains the influential German band's three original albums plus some rarities, including sessions from an aborted 1986 reunion.

title: Angel Echoes Remix
label: Domino
description: Bundling all the recent remixes of Four Tet into one digital package, this set features work from Caribou, Joy Orbison, Floating Points, and Mosca.

title: Come Hell or High Water
label: Benbecula
description: The large trans-continental project led by Greg Jarvis returns with an evocative album that balances stately chamber pop with noise and drone.

title: Pink Graffiti
label: Western Vinyl
description: Fargo, N.D., band all but sends mash notes to the 90s rosters of K, Merge, or Matador throughout this throwback indie rock record.

title: The Runaway
label: Heavenly
description: Third album from the UK indie band finds them experimenting with a wider array of sounds to mixed effect.

title: Villa Manifesto
label: E1
description: The Detroit crew returns with their first full-length since the deaths of producer J Dilla and founding member Baatin.

title: The Terror of Cosmic Loneliness
artist: Tony Da Gatorra vs. Gruff Rhys
label: Turnstile
description: Super Furry Animals singer teams with a Brazilian VCR repairman/peace activist to craft a record on a homemade synthesizer/drum-machine.

title: Fields Within Fields
label: Three Lobed
description: Like Robedoor, Heavy Winged prove long-form jams on traditional rock instruments can still produce forward-looking drone.

title: XXX
label: !K7
description: Discovered in his teens by Warp, Edgar grows up, moves to !K7, and seems to like strip clubs (and strip-club music).

title: Dual Identity
label: Clean Feed
description: Two of the finest saxophonists going collaborate on this album that serves as a great entry point into contemporary progressive jazz.

title: United Nations of Sound
label: Parlophone
description: Richard Ashcroft responds to the failure of the Verve v. 3.0  with an album of excitable, populist electro-soul.

title: Crazy For You
label: Mexican Summer
description: California's Bethany Cosentino delivers on the promise of her noisy early singles with a richer-sounding album that highlights the power of her voice.

title: Blue Giant
label: Vanguard
description: The principals from Portland's Viva Voce team with members of Golden Bears, Swords, and the Decemberists for a more rustic take on indie pop.

title: Pestilence & Joy
label: Evolving Ear
description: One of the more intriguing and unclassifiable acts in experimental music releases a consistent record that deals in a kind of symphonic minimalism.

title: Somewhere on the Golden Coast
label: TBD
description: Often called the Californian Hold Steady, HCP combine the easy guitar-pop of Weezer and Pavement with detail-rich lyrical acumen.

title: On Patrol
label: Not Not Fun
description: Sun Araw's muggy psych-trance is given space and time to stretch out, simmer, deepen, and the results move from mesmeric to narcotic.

title: Mines
label: Barsuk
description: On their third pop album, Menomena dial back a bit, focusing as much on conventional songwriting as jamming, looping, and editing, to very good effect.

title: Contoured Heat
label: Licking River
description: Chicago pysch-rock band bows out with an album that pairs their raw, visceral music with lengthy instrumental excursions.

title: Rural Route No. 2
label: Standard Form
description: Rising drone artist reminiscent of William Basinski and Stars of the Lid finds new shades of emotion and intensity in his overcast compositions.

title: Record: The Best of Zero 7
label: Warner Bros.
description: Downtempo kingpins round up their hits and somehow have gathered remixes from Dilla, Joker, Justus Kohncke, Fred Falke, and others for a Disc Two.

title: Welcome Home/Diggin' the Universe
label: Woodsist
description: Woodsist offer ramshackle rock plus forays into twee and pop-punk on this label comp. Woods, Fresh & Onlys, Ducktails, and Skygreen Leopards appear.

title: Crooks & Lovers
label: Hotflush
description: After two stellar EPs, this post-dubstep duo again turns club and R&B influences into something, like Boards of Canada or James Blake, best enjoyed alone.

title: The Long Shadow of the Paper Tiger
label: K
description: Chicago band enlists guest musicians, trading the peaks and valleys of its previous albums for overall danceable consistency.

title: Butterfly House
label: Deltasonic
description: Working with producer John Leckie, the Merseyside band soldiers on after the departure of guitarist Bill Ryder-Jones.

title: Beyond the Valley of Ultrahits
label: Jagjaguwar
description: Best known for minimalism, noise, and avant-folk, Richard Youngs created this CD-R of "proper pop" music on a dare. Jagjaguwar now re-releases it.

title: Twin-Hand Movement
label: Gnomonsong
description: Jana Hunter teams up with a new band that provides her with unhinged, dreamy rock more often in the service of atmosphere than her voice.

title: Archives 2003-2006
label: American Dust
description: Grizzly Bear's Daniel Rossen issues a collection of rich, revelatory material recorded between his other group's two albums.

title: Art School Girls
label: Green Owl
description: It's like ironic hipster rap and blog-house never ended.

title: Interpretations: The British Rock Songbook
label: Anti-
description: The soul veteran puts her own spin on songs by the Who, the Beatles, Led Zeppelin, and more.
